author.name: Linus
author.description: thought & craft · ex @replit @hackclub @dormroomfund

html: The fact that LLMs generate text is not the point. LLMs are cheap, infinitely scalable black boxes to soft human-like reasoning. That's the headline! The text I/O mode is just the API to this reasoning genie. It's a side effect of the training paradigm.

author.name: Codex OS

html:
The point of a PKM / personal bicycle for the mind is surely to augment my own individuality and idiosyncrasies. 

If, instead, it gives me some crunch of everyone else's individuality, what am I getting?

\5

"He clasps the crag with crooked hands;
Close to the sun in lonely lands,
Ringed with the azure world, he stands.

The wrinkled sea beneath him crawls;
He watches from his mountain walls,
And like a thunderbolt he falls."

html: By far the most valuable aspect of Twitter for me has been the real-life relationships it's created—most of my close friends. html:
The interesting thing about tech debt is that if the app ends up moving away from the imagined solution that the debt was incurred for then the debt, as such, evaporates as if it never existed.

Tech debt can be erased by future decisions.

Was it even debt to begin with?

author.name: Andy Matuschak
author.description: More wonder, more insight, more capacity, more joy!\n\nCurrently exploring tools that augment human memory and attention.

html: Was reminded recently of one of my favorite papers on social learning. It centers on a clever lie!\n\nSubjects study some material, then quiz either a peer or a bot about it. They learn much better when they think they're quizzing a peer. Secretly, in both cases, it's a bot! https://t.co/8foRfTu62x

A 2000 year old Roman mosaic washed by waters of mighty river Euphrates in ancient city of Zeugma in Türkiye.

It was discovered in 2000 in a Roman villa of ancient city during rescue excavations and it is thought to date from 1st century CE.

html:
I started a series of PDSA loops to experiment with improving "value-based" reading.

For example, how do I select what is relevant and important?

How much time do I spend reading each topic?

How much time a day can I read?

These are not easy answers to these questions.

html:
Text:
(1) Aaa (2) Bbbb (3) Ccc (4) 
Outside text:
1st link goes from 1 to 3,
2nd link goes from 2 to 4

AFAIK only @codexeditor implemented that pattern.

It's also useful if the user B has only read access to what user A wrote. Markers can be set & the links kept in B's area

author.name: Gareth Harney
author.description: Celebrating the endless wonders of the Roman world. “For these Romans I set no bounds in space or time; but have given empire without end.”

html: 1) The perfectly preserved monumental marble doors of a Macedonian tomb dating to the 4th century BC. The sealed tomb was buried under a 6.5m tumulus, yet raiders still tunnelled in and robbed its treasures in antiquity. Fortunately these ornate marble doors were left untouched.. https://t.co/SAYee7sJG1

author.name: Archaeo - Histories

An Etruscan bronze figurine depicting Sleep (Hypnos) and Death (Thanatos) carrying away Sarpedon of Lykia, son of Zeus, after he was slain by Patroclus, friend of Achilles, during Trojan War, as recounted in Illiad.

This piece was made between 400-380 BC.

author.name: Tudor Girba
author.description: Software environmentalist | CEO @feenkcom

html:
When a system is not testable, stop and make it testable.

When a system is not deployable, stop and make it deployable.

Both challenged the status quo in their time. The time has come for a new challenge:

When a system is not explainable, stop and make it explainable.

html: 18 November 1938 | A Dutch Jewish girl, Flore Merjam Cohn, was born in Amsterdam.\n\nShe arrived at #Auschwitz on 2 September 1943 in a transport of 1,004 Jews deported from Westerbork. She was among 498 of them murdered in a gas chamber after the selection. https://t.co/CiWAaOQvuF

html: The Banff Wildlife Crossings Project was implemented in Banff, Alberta. Combined with fencing to keep the animals off the road, the structures have reduced animal-vehicle collisions in the area by more than 80% (>96% for elk and deer alone) \n\n[read more: https://t.co/9oPSR7OjuD] https://t.co/gP406Q7fxF
